intro: Anuragia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly anuragia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy, grayish foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
